memberdef.name: STUFF_PREALLOC
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ unsigned int _i = 0 ; \ unsigned int _prefered = 0 ; \ \ _prefered = GetPreferedPool( _nb, sizeof(_type) ); \ _pool= NULL ; \ \ if( ( _pool = ( _type *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( _type ) * _prefered ) ) != NULL ) \ { \ for( _i = 0 ; _i < ( unsigned int)_prefered ; _i++ ) \ { \ if( _i != _prefered -1 ) \ _pool[_i]._name_next = &(_pool[_i+1]) ; \ else \ _pool[_i]._name_next = NULL ; \ } \ } \ } while( 0 )

detaileddescription.para: STUFF_PREALLOC: Allocates a pool of pre-allocated entries.

This macro Allocates a pool of pre-allocated entries. It calls malloc to get the spool as an arry and then chains all the entries together. Each entry is supposed to have a specific 'next' field, a pointer to an object of its own type, to be used as a pointer to the next entry in the pool.
If BuddyMalloc is used, it is supposed to be already initialised.

parameterdescription.para: the preallocted pool that we want to init.
the number of entries to be allocated.
the type of the entries to be allocated.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.

simplesect.para: nothing (this is a macro), but pool will be NULL if an error occures.

memberdef.name: GET_PREALLOC
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ \ if( ( _pool == NULL ) && ( _nb != 0 ) ) \ STUFF_PREALLOC( _pool, _nb, _type, _name_next ) ; \ \ if( _pool != NULL ) \ { \ _entry = _pool ; \ _pool = _entry->_name_next ; \ } \ else \ _entry = NULL ; \ } while( 0 )

detaileddescription.para: GET_PREALLOC: Gets an entry in a preallocated pool.

This macro is used to get an entry from a pre-allocated pool. If the pool is empty, the macro STUFF_PREALLOC will be called with the same last four arguments to extend the pool. If nb is set to zero during this call, STUFF_PREALLOC is not called and no entry is get from the pool that is empty.

parameterdescription.para: the entry we need.
the preallocted pool that we want to init.
the number of entries to be allocated.
the type of the entries to be allocated.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.

simplesect.para: nothing (this is a macro), but entry will be NULL if an error occures.

detaileddescription.para: RELEASE_PREALLOC: Releases an entry and puts it back to the pool.
When an entry is no used any more, this macro is used to put it back to the pool, so that it could be reuse later. The released entry is chained to the pool, through the 'name_next' field.

parameterdescription.para: the entry to be released.
the pool to which the entry belongs.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.

memberdef.name: STUFF_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ unsigned int _i = 0 ; \ unsigned int _prefered = 0 ; \ \ _prefered = GetPreferedPool( _nb, sizeof(_type) ); \ \ _pool = ( _type *)Mem_Calloc( _prefered, sizeof( _type ) ) ; \ \ if( _pool != NULL ) \ { \ for( _i = 0 ; _i < _prefered ; _i++ ) \ { \ if( _i != _prefered -1 ) \ _pool[_i]._name_next = &(_pool[_i+1]) ; \ else \ _pool[_i]._name_next = NULL ; \ \ if( _construct != NULL ) \ _construct( (void *)&(_pool[_i]) ) ; \ \ } \ } \ } while( 0 )

detaileddescription.para: STUFF_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT: Allocates a pool of pre-allocated entries with a call to a constructor.

This macro Allocates a pool of pre-allocated entries. It calls malloc to get the spool as an arry and then chains all the entries together. Each entry is supposed to have a specific 'next' field, a pointer to an object of its own type, to be used as a pointer to the next entry in the pool.
If BuddyMalloc is used, it is supposed to be already initialised.

parameterdescription.para: the preallocted pool that we want to init.
the number of entries to be allocated.
the type of the entries to be allocated.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.
the constructor for the object: takes a pointer to void as argument and returns void

simplesect.para: nothing (this is a macro), but pool will be NULL if an error occures.

memberdef.name: GET_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ if( ( _pool == NULL ) && ( _nb != 0 ) ) \ STUFF_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT( _pool, _nb, _type, _name_next, _construct ) ; \ \ if( _pool != NULL ) \ { \ _entry = _pool ; \ _pool = _entry->_name_next ; \ } \ else \ _entry = NULL ; \ } while( 0 )

detaileddescription.para: GET_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT: Gets an entry in a preallocated pool.

This macro is used to get an entry from a pre-allocated pool. If the pool is empty, the macro STUFF_PREALLOC will be called with the same last four arguments to extend the pool. If nb is set to zero during this call, STUFF_PREALLOC is not called and no entry is get from the pool that is empty.

parameterdescription.para: the entry we need.
the preallocted pool that we want to init.
the number of entries to be allocated.
the type of the entries to be allocated.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.
the constructor for the object: takes a pointer to void as argument and returns void

simplesect.para: nothing (this is a macro), but entry will be NULL if an error occures.

memberdef.name: RELEASE_PREALLOC_DESTRUCT
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ destruct( (void *)entry ) ; \ entry->name_next = pool ; \ pool = entry ; \ } while( 0 )

detaileddescription.para: RELEASE_PREALLOC_DESTRUCT: Releases an entry and puts it back to the pool with a destructor.
When an entry is no used any more, this macro is used to put it back to the pool, so that it could be reuse later. The released entry is chained to the pool, through the 'name_next' field.

parameterdescription.para: the entry to be released.
the pool to which the entry belongs.
the name of the field, in structure of type 'type' which pointer to the next entry.
the destructor for the object: takes a pointer to void as argument and returns void
